findings.title: The real transferFrom function is not realized
findings.description: The actual implementation of the transferFrom function is missing.

findings.title: Transfer is accessible only from proxy contract
findings.description: The transfer function can only be accessed through the proxy contract.

findings.title: _icoTransfer function transfers only bonus amount
findings.description: The _icoTransfer function only transfers the bonus amount, which may lead to unintended behavior or security risks.

findings.title: Proxy address can call transferFrom function
findings.description: The proxy contract has the capability to invoke the transferFrom function, which may lead to unintended consequences.

findings.title: Admin address can call icoTransfer
findings.description: The admin address has the privilege to call the icoTransfer function.

findings.title: Admin address can call earlyBackerTransfer
findings.description: The admin address has the privilege to call the earlyBackerTransfer function, which may lead to unauthorized access or manipulation.

findings.title: Admin address can call burn
findings.description: The admin address has the privilege to call the burn function.

findings.title: Admin address can change proxy contract
findings.description: The admin address has the privilege to change the proxy contract, which may lead to unauthorized changes or potential security risks.

findings.title: Admin address can upgrade Ico Stage
findings.description: The admin address has the privilege to upgrade the ICO stage, which may lead to unintended consequences or malicious actions.

findings.title: FibonAdmin owner can change main contract and call main contract admin functions
findings.description: The FibonAdmin owner has privileges to modify the main contract and execute administrative functions within it.

findings.title: FibonProxy owner can change main contract
findings.description: The FibonProxy owner has the privilege to modify the main contract, which poses a high risk of unauthorized changes.
